issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NC fails to adopt instance in case of connect iscsi failure

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Volume attachment is failing in eucalyptus 4.3 and CentOS 7.2:

{noformat}
2016-03-02 11:40:23  INFO 000024439 doAttachVolume           | [i-9ba7fb3c][vol-e83d1c89] attaching volume
2016-03-02 11:40:23 DEBUG 000024439 doAttachVolume           | [i-9ba7fb3c][vol-e83d1c89] volume attaching (remoteDev=sc://vol-e83d1c89, localDev=/dev/vdc)
2016-03-02 11:40:24 ERROR 000032439 scStubCreate             | cannot get AXIS2C_HOME2016-03-02 11:40:24 DEBUG 000024439 scClientCall             |     done scOps=ExportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=1
2016-03-02 11:40:24 ERROR 000024439 connect_ebs_volume       | Failed to get connection information for volume vol-e83d1c89 from storage controller at: http://10.111.5.154:8773/services/Storage
2016-03-02 11:40:24 ERROR 000024439 connect_ebs              | Error connecting ebs volume sc://vol-e83d1c89,
2016-03-02 11:40:24 ERROR 000024439 ncAttachVolumeMarshal    | [i-9ba7fb3c][vol-e83d1c89] failed error=1
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              | path '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work' resolved
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              |   to '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work' with ID 0
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              |   of size 214635118592 bytes with available 203475984384 bytes
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              | path '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache' resolved
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              |   to '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache' with ID 0
2016-03-02 11:40:25 DEBUG 000024485 statfs_path              |   of size 214635118592 bytes with available 203475984384 bytes
2016-03-02 11:40:26 DEBUG 000024439 doDescribeResource       | Core status:   in-use 3 physical 4 over-committed no
{noformat}
(nc.log log attached)

This is only happening with CentOS 7.2. Volume attachment works file in CentOS 6.7.

Also, the failed volume causes similar issue with instance adaption upon eucalyptus-nc restart like EUCA-12033, where NC loses track of instance but {{virsh list}} continues to run the instance. See instance {{i-f5687a20}} in nc.log for detail.
fields.summary: Volume attachment fails for missing AXIS2C_HOME in CentOS 7

If the value is known at build time, it should be set to that as default. It may be overridden from a config file. 

Setting the env variable in the init script is a temporary workaround. [~gholms] will apply the workaround.
[~jbreiding], could you have a look if something can/needs to be done in the code?

Given EUCA-12046 should be covered under the same solution I believe we should push this off to a dot release.

Changes could be made to the configure.ac and eucalyptus-config.h.in to support this better but we also need to remove the generated configure from the repo as well.

I could make changes the a couple of source files and the Makefile to pass in this value but that would affect only the node controller.

Thoughts?
I'd think we can postpone merging [~jbreiding] changes till next release. Any objections?
The "workaround" is what we've been doing for many years. We can live with it in 4.3 and we will plan to improve the implementation in the next release.
